results.title: Pathe pictorial goes to sea
results.brief_description: Waves breaking in the sea. Old ships; cadets in training on sailing ships. Knot tying. Schooling on a trawler at Grimbsy. Throwing nets. Fishing boats and nets a shore. Old seaman finding a bottle with a message from a ship-wrecked man to his wife - he goes to the city and looks for her (shown as an incongruous figure out of place in the city). Finds only ruins.
results.description: Waves breaking in the sea. Old ships; cadets in training on sailing ships. Knot tying. Schooling on a trawler at Grimbsy. Throwing nets. Fishing boats and nets a shore. results.title: Pathe news: Sierra Leone independence
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: The ceremonies and celebrations preceding Independence Day in Sierra Leone, and events in the capital city of Freetown on the day of inauguration. HRH the Duke of Kent, representing Her Majesty the Queen, is seen attending a party at Government House, and speaking at the State Opening of the Sierra Leone Parliament. A water regatta and displays of traditional dancing are among the activities enjoyed by the people of Sierra Leone.

results.title: Pathe news: Shakespeare's 400th anniversary
results.brief_description: Events at Stratford-upon-Avon to commemorate the four hundredth birthday of William Shakespeare. Celebrations included the opening of the new Shakespeare Centre, and a procession of local dignitaries with representatives from 115 nations, to lay wreaths on the poet’s tomb at Holy Trinity Church. H.R.H the Duke of Edinburgh arrived to pay tribute, visiting Shakespeare Centre the cottage where the poet was born, and the Royal Shakespeare Memorial Theatre on the banks of the Avon.

results.title: Pathe's animated gazette. No. 346
results.brief_description: This film is made up of the following items: leading Paris fashions; Trafalgar day march; Corporal Bassett, the first New Zealander to win the VC; the destroyed town of Mount St. Eloy; Sir Very Strong visits Bethnal Green military hospital; training recruits in mining and bombing attacks; ammunitions factories; inspection of French artillery; exhibition of German weapons.

results.title: Path to nationhood
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: The story of the 1964 elections in Papua and New Guinea, including complation of the Common Roll, the voting, counting and declaration of the polls for the election of the House of Assembly.

results.title: Patal Gange - River of the Gods
results.creator_credit: UNICEF, John Balcomb and Jon Weinberger
results.brief_description: The search for clean water and the education of children and adults of an Indian village ti the perils of contaminated supplies. With the advice and blessing of the village seer and priest, respectively, a UNICEF rig accompanies the drilling of a well to make clean, fresh water available to people in a village.

results.title: Pat Whalan's world of floral art. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Building on skills demonstrated in Part 1, Pat shows how to create a Victorian Posy, the Florist’s Posy, a formal bouquet with handle and an informal Table Arrangement using oasis.

results.title: Pat Whalan's World of Floral Art. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Australian gardening and radio personality, Pat Whalan demonstrates the skill of the professional florist. Learn how to make buttonholes, posies and corsages using special wiring techniques.
